Muscarinic antagonist that suppresses vestibular stimulation and controls nausea and vertigo.
Improves blood flow in the inner ear and reduces vertigo episodes.
Benzodiazepine that reduces central nervous system activity during acute vertigo attacks.
Corticosteroid that reduces liver inflammation in severe alcoholic hepatitis.
TNF-alpha inhibitor that reduces inflammatory response and liver damage.
Naturally occurring compound that supports liver detoxification and regeneration.
Antioxidant that boosts glutathione levels and protects the liver from oxidative stress.
Second-generation antihistamine that blocks H1 receptors to reduce allergy symptoms.
Non-sedating antihistamine used for allergic rhinitis and urticaria.
Leukotriene receptor antagonist that reduces inflammation in allergic reactions.
Inhaled corticosteroid that reduces nasal inflammation in allergies.
Short-acting beta-agonist (SABA) that opens airways during asthma attacks.
Inhaled corticosteroid that reduces chronic airway inflammation in asthma.
Used as an add-on therapy to prevent bronchoconstriction and reduce inflammation.
Methylxanthine bronchodilator that relaxes smooth muscles in the airways.
Biguanide that lowers glucose production in the liver and increases insulin sensitivity.
Sulfonylurea that stimulates insulin release from pancreatic beta cells.
Fast-acting analog of human insulin used to manage blood sugar in type 1 and advanced type 2 diabetes.
SGLT2 inhibitor that increases glucose excretion through urine

Immune modulator that enhances immune response against HBV.
Longer-acting form of interferon used in chronic HBV infection.

NS5A inhibitor used in combination therapy for genotype 1 and 3 HCV infections.
Nucleoside analog often combined with other antivirals to increase cure rates.
Common brand-name DAA combinations for treating chronic hepatitis C.

Enhances immune response against HDV; remains key therapy in many patients.

Mild analgesic for pain relief without significant anti-inflammatory effect.
